summary: The Apples to Apples Comparison Act of 2025 amends the Social Security Act to enhance transparency regarding Medicare expenditures. It mandates the Secretary of Health and Human Services to publish detailed expenditure information on the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services website, broken down by various beneficiary categories, including those enrolled in Part A, Part B, and Medicare Advantage plans. The bill also requires the Medicare Payment Advisory Commission (MedPAC) to analyze and report on Medicare Advantage and fee-for-service expenditures and for the Boards of Trustees to include expenditure information in their reports.
